sense.name: anything which is ranked as very important
sense.commentary: PRIORITY[+entity][+ranked][+important][+highly] Note: can occur in the plural Note: refers to the thing itself, not a status or attribute assigned to is. (Sense 2)
sense.examples: Repairing the roof is on our list of priorities. Reduced spending was not a priority of their administration. Her children are her top priority.

sense.name: the state of having important status
sense.commentary: PRIORITY[+state][+status][+ranked][+important] Note: refers to a quality assigned to something, not the thing explicitly (see Sense 1)
sense.examples: The safety of the passengers takes priority over ease of travel. Priority will be given to those with press passes. Clear the left lane for only the traffic with priority. (ambulances, etc.)

sense.name: being earlier in time, occurring before something else
sense.examples: John was credited with the idea because his paper had priority over the others. (was published earlier) No one knows which society had priority in the invention of writing. (was historically the first)
